meanings.definition: To go for and bring back; retrieve.
meanings.sent1: I fetched my ball from the yard.
meanings.sent2: She fetched a book from the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The dog fetched the stick and proudly returned it.
meanings.sent4: His words fetched memories of childhood.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sunset fetched a sense of peace.

meanings.sent1: The teacher fetched the students to the classroom.
meanings.sent2: He fetched a smile to her face with his joke.
meanings.sent3: The magician fetched a rabbit out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: Her music fetched emotions to the surface.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies fetched everyone to the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To be sold for a certain price.
meanings.sent1: The painting fetched a high price at the auction.
meanings.sent2: The antique vase fetched a good amount at the market.
meanings.sent3: The old comic book fetched a surprising sum of money.
meanings.sent4: Her talent fetched a lucrative deal.
meanings.sent5: The rare stamp fetched a record price at the sale.
